image.altText: An anonymous schoolgirl walks down a corridor, away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Fewer than one in five public schools in the ACT are expected to meet budget this year, and now union representatives say classes are being merged and teachers cancelled to deal with the deficit.

title.children: Principals combine classes, cut teachers amid budget woes: union

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Rick McGary, who has been on trial three times for rape, is now behind bars after a jury found him guilty of two charges against two women.Â

title.children: Former Canberra academic found guilty of raping two women

image.altText: Two hailstones sitting in the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: The frequency of "giant" hail and the number of hail days in a season could increase substantially for multiple Australian cities as the climate warms, a new study has found.

title.children: The Australian cities bracing for more giant hail as climate warms

image.altText: Joseph stands holding a wire fence near his cafe, outside in Garema Place. He wears a black winter coat and blue jumper.

props.synopsis: A gazebo in the heart of the CBD is at the centre of a row between the government and a hospitality venue owner. He says it's already cost him $150,000.

title.children: Restaurateur rips down $150k gazebo, claims government U-turn

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe pleads guilty to the stabbing murder of Tshewang Choden at the National Zoo and Aquarium in December 2023.

title.children: 'Prettiest name in the world': Man's text to co-worker before her murder

image.altText: Two houses with smoking chimneys and city in background.

props.synopsis: Wood heaters are estimated to be responsible for more pollution-related deaths than all the cars on our roads. This national map shows which areas are affected the most.Â

title.children: Neighbours clash over chimney smoke as map shows pollution hotspots

image.altText: Three people touching a rusted box-shaped monument.

props.synopsis: When 11-year-old Annette Taylor suffered an unexpected cerebral brain haemorrhage and died four days later, she went on to make history.

title.children: Annette was just 11 when she made history as an organ donor

image.altText: A wide shot of a multi-story residential building shown during the day on a partly cloudy day

props.synopsis: Ukrainian officials say Russian strikes on the frontline region of Zaporizhzhia have killed at least 16 people and injured dozens more.Â

title.children: Ukraine calls Russian strike on penal colony 'another war crime'

image.altText: SBS newsreader Mary Kostakidis

props.synopsis: A legal row between a former SBS television newsreader and a prominent Israeli Australian over tweets during the IsraelâGaza war has been described by one camp as a case of free speech, and the other as a case of hate speech.

title.children: Former SBS newsreader's social media posts trigger lawsuit

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest employers axes 45 jobs in its customer call centres after rolling out an artificial intelligence chatbot to deal with customer inquiries.

title.children: CBA replaces dozens of call centre jobs with AI chatbot

image.altText: Two hailstones sitting in the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: The frequency of "giant" hail and the number of hail days in a season could increase substantially for multiple Australian cities as the climate warms, a new study has found.

title.children: The Australian cities bracing for more giant hail as climate warms

image.altText: Primary school kids carrying backpacks on a rainy winter day.

props.synopsis: Teachers are preparing to hold a 24-hour strike next Wednesday as pay negotiations with the state government hit a stalemate.

title.children: Queensland teachers to strike, nurses angry over 'swift' police pay deal

image.altText: Aerial of sheep wandering among the solar panels at Numurkah solar farm

props.synopsis: The approval of a solar farm in just 30 business days is an example of how the renewables rollout could be sped up if Australia's ageing environment laws were rewritten, the government says.Â

title.children: Solar farm approved in weeks shows how renewables rollout could speed up

image.altText: Ross Garnaut

props.synopsis: The father of emissions trading in Australia has warned the nation is "on a path to comprehensive failure" without the urgent reintroduction of a carbon price.

title.children: Australia can 'spend a fortune to buy failure' or reintroduce a carbon price

image.altText: exterior of building with trees in foreground

props.synopsis: Initial reports suggest the young child sustained minor injuries after allegedly being struck with a mop. Â

title.children: Police investigate alleged assault on boy in Cairns childcare centre

image.altText: A torch pointed at a white patch.

props.synopsis: The ABC's Foreign Correspondent travels to cartel country in Mexico to see if the government's crackdown on drug cartels is working.

title.children: The 'astounding' secret police discovered under a Mexican cartel town

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Job mobility is down, retrenchment is up and more than a million Australians are ready to start working immediately, the Australian Bureau of Statistics says.Â

title.children: More than a million unemployed Australians are job ready: ABS

image.altText: ny shooting

props.synopsis: A gunman has killed four people, including an off-duty police officer, in a New York office building before taking his own life, officials say.

title.children: Five dead in New York office building shooting, including gunman

image.altText: Emergency authorities attend to residents in rescue boats floating on floodwaters.

props.synopsis: At least 30 people have been killed after torrential downpours hit the Chinese capital, damaging roads, bringing down power poles and uprooting trees.

title.children: Heavy rains and floods kill 30 in Beijing

image.altText: Joan Anderson hula hooping

props.synopsis: Joan Anderson, who spotted a new fad on a trip back to Australia and brought the hula hoop to the attention of a US toy company, dies aged 101.

title.children: Australian woman behind worldwide hula hoop sensation dies age 101

image.altText: SES and police vehicles beside a road.

props.synopsis: A crime scene has been established at the site where part of a skull was found along the Murray River at Mildura.Â

title.children: Walker finds partial skull on riverbank near Mildura holiday park

image.altText: A woman sits with her hands folded on her lap looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: A mother found not guilty of attempted murder by way of mental incompetence after stabbing her two sons multiple times on an Adelaide motorway, has been sentenced to a limited fixed term of 12 years in a mental health facility.

title.children: Adelaide mother sentenced to time in mental health facility after stabbing sons

image.altText: A light-coloured single-storey building with green lawn, a driveway and metal gates in front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland childcare worker has been charged with torturing and repeatedly assaulting a one-year-old baby boy.

title.children: Educator charged with torturing baby boy in childcare centre

image.altText: A glass door with the Ramsay Psychology words and logo on it.

props.synopsis: Face-to-face mental health support saved Kate's life, now her health care provider wants her to move to telehealth instead.Â

title.children: Clients 'disgusted and appalled' by Ramsay psychology clinic shutdowns

image.altText: a vehicle running over a crocodile at a river crossing

props.synopsis: A video of a large crocodile becoming stuck underneath a ute at a notorious river crossing in the Northern Territory has gone viral online.

title.children: Video shows crocodile stuck under ute as it crosses NT river

image.altText: A woman sitting on a deck chair with green grass behind her

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Australians slugged more than $60 million in excessive bank fees could soon get a refund, but Commonwealth Bank customers may not see a cent of $270 million in unfair charges.

title.children: Commbank refuses to pay millions in refunds to low-income customers

image.altText: An AI-generated image shows a smiling woman with blonde hair wearing a short blue dress siting outside.

props.synopsis: The advertisement in Vogue has sparked significant controversy, with some claiming it threatens diversity in fashion and reinforces already unattainable beauty standards.

title.children: Her features are flawless. But this blonde model in Vogue isn't real

props.synopsis: Rick McGary, who has been on trial three times for rape, is now behind bars after a jury found him guilty of two charges against two women.Â

title.children: Former Canberra academic found guilty of raping two women

image.altText: Lili Greer as a child hugging her mum Tina

props.synopsis: While Lili says her experience with violence and loss will have lifelong impacts, advocating for change has been part of her healing. Â Â

title.children: Advocating to end gender-based violence has helped Lili keep her mum's memory alive

image.altText: A light dusting of snow on the ground on the Bluff Knoll peak

props.synopsis:
Snow chasers have three opportunities in eight days to frolic in the white stuff on peaks in Stirling Range National Park.

Â

title.children: Winter records broken as WA sees three days of snow

image.altText: A close up photo of an older man with glasses and a receding hairline

props.synopsis: Sir Michael Hill, the founder of jewellery brand Michael Hill, has died aged 86. The company has remembered its founder as a "celebrated jeweller, entrepreneur [and] philanthropist".

title.children: Jewellery tycoon Michael Hill dies after taking leave for cancer treatment

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court in Townsville

props.synopsis: A Queensland man has been jailed for blackmail after extorting $1.7 million from a woman across 10 years, threatening to expose their past affair.

title.children: Man jailed for 10 years for blackmailing former lover out of $1.7m

image.altText: A line of coal train carriages in front of a coal washer machine which is partially covered in fog.

props.synopsis: The mine has cut two-thirds of its workforce as its debt continues to climb past the $800 million mark.Â

title.children: Troubled mine crumbles as mass redundancies hit

image.altText: A political sticker about Medicare and free doctor visits stuck on another sign that says "Queens Domain".

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Labor will need to decide whether to ignore or pay a request for payment from Hobart City Council for the clean-up costs of promotional material from city bus stops, bins and power poles.

title.children: Labor asked to pay Hobart city for removal of 'unlawful' election signage

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, purple tie and white shirt stands speaking behind a lectern decorated with flowers

props.synopsis: Taiwan's president is set to delay a diplomatically sensitive trip his team had floated to the US because of ongoing USâChina trade talks, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title.children: Taiwan to push back US stopover amid USâChina trade talks, sources say
